title: Psychodynamic Psychotherapy Expert Training Program for Borderline Personality Disorder Treatment [K-12]

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Theoretical Knowledge of Psychiatry and Clinical Experience
context.additional_context: Blended Online-Offline Education Program Designed for Graduate Students and Psychiatrists, Enhancing Practical Competencies Through Project-Based Learning with Real Clinical Cases

learning_goals: Explain clinical characteristics of borderline personality disorder (BPD) and its pathological development mechanisms
Develop treatment plans for BPD patients applying psychodynamic psychotherapy theories
Students can create and evaluate diagnostic reports applying psychodynamic therapy techniques through real-world case studies
Students can write treatment process notes reflecting peer feedback in online learning modules and PBL environments
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
